convert_alleles(alleles)[source]¶

Converts alleles into the interal allele representation of the predictor and returns a string representation

Parameters:alleles (list(Allele)) – The alleles for which the internal predictor representation is needed
Returns:Returns a string representation of the input alleles
name¶

Returns the name of the predictor

Returns:
predict(peptides, alleles=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Predicts the binding affinity for a given peptide or peptide lists for a given list of alleles. If alleles is not given, predictions for all valid alleles of the predictor is performed. If, however, a list of alleles is given, predictions for the valid allele subset is performed.

Parameters:
  • peptides (Peptide/list(Peptide)) – The peptide objects for which predictions should be performed
  • alleles (Allele/list(Allele)) – An Allele or list of Alleles for which prediction models should be used
Returns:

Returns a AResult object for the specified Peptides and Alleles
registry = {}¶

Returns:List of allele names for which the predictor provides models

class Fred2.Core.Base.AExternal[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for external tools

command¶

defines the external execution path ? :return:

get_external_version(path=None)[source]¶

Returns the external version of the tool by executing >{command} –version

might be dependent on the method and has to be overwritten therefore it is declared abstract to enforce the user to overwrite the method. The function in the base class can be called with super()

Parameters:path ((str)) –
  • optional specification of executable path if deviant from self.__command
Returns:str - The external version of the tool
is_in_path()[source]¶

checks whether the specified execution command can be found in PATH

Returns:bool - Whether or not command could be found in PATH
parse_external_result(_file)[source]¶

Parses external NetMHC results and returns a AResult object

Parameters:_file (str) – The file path or the external prediction results
Returns:AResult - Returns a AResult object
prepare_peptide_input(_peptides, _file)[source]¶

Prepares sequence input for external tools and writes them to _file in the specific format

NO return value!

Param:(list(str)) _peptides: the peptide sequences to write into _file
Parameters:_file ((File)) – File handler to input file for external tool

class Fred2.Core.Base.MetadataLogger[source]¶

Bases: object

This class provides a simple interface for assigning additional metadata to any object in our data model. Examples: storing ANNOVAR columns like depth, base count, dbSNP id, quality information for variants, prediction scores for peptides etc. Normally used by custom toolbox functions and importers.

The saved values are accessed via log_metadata() and get_metadata()

get_metadata(label, only_first=False)[source]¶

Getter for the saved metadata with the key label

Parameters:
  • label (str) – key for the metadata that is inferred
  • only_first (bool) – true if only the the first element of the matadata list is to be returned
log_metadata(label, value)[source]¶

Inserts a new metadata

Parameters:
  • label (str) – key for the metadata that will be added
  • value (list(object)) – any kindy of additional value that should be kept

Fred2.Core.Generator module¶

Fred2.Core.Generator.generate_peptides_from_protein(proteins, window_size, peptides=None)[source]¶

Creates all peptides for a given window size, from a given protein. The result is a generator.

Parameters:
  • proteins (Protein) – (list of) protein(s) from which a list of unique peptides should be generated
  • window_size (int) – size of peptide fragments

generates polymorphic peptides based on given variants

  • vars (list(Variant)) – list of Variants
  • length (int) – length of peptides
  • dbadapter – DBAdapter to fetch the transcript sequences
Returns:

List(Peptide) – A list of polymorphic peptides

Fred2.Core.Generator.generate_transcripts_from_tumor_variants(normal, tumor, dbadapter)[source]¶

generates all possible transcript variations of the given variants

Parameters:
  • normal (list(Variant)) – A list of variants of the normal tissue
  • tumor (list(Variant)) – A list of variant of the cancer tissue for which transcript should be generated
  • dbadapter (ADBAdapter) – a DBAdapter to fetch the transcript sequences
Returns:

(Generator(Transcripts)) – a generator of transcripts with all possible variations determined by the given variant list

Bases: Fred2.Core.Base.MetadataLogger, Bio.Seq.Seq

This class encapsulates a Peptide, belonging to one or several Proteins.

Fred2.Core.Protein module¶

class Fred2.Core.Protein.Protein(_seq, _gene_id='unknown', _transcript_id=None, _orig_transcript=None, _vars=None)[source]¶

Bases: Fred2.Core.Base.MetadataLogger, Bio.Seq.Seq

Protein corresponding to exactly one transcript.

Note

For accessing and manipulating the sequence see also Bio.Seq.Seq (from Biopython)

Parameters:
  • gene_id (str) – ID of the genome
  • transcript_id (str) – ID of the corresponding transcript
  • orig_transcript (Transcript) – Reference to the originating transcript
  • _vars (dict(int,list(Variant))) – Nonsynonymous variants that are assoziated with the protein. key=position within protein, value=list of variants at that pos

Fred2.Core.Result module¶

class Fred2.Core.Result.AResult(data=None, index=None, columns=None, dtype=None, copy=False)[source]¶

Bases: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

A AResult object is a DataFrame with with multi-indexing.

This class is used as interface and can be extended with custom short-cuts for the sometimes often tedious calls in pandas

filter_result(expression)[source]¶

filter result based on a list of expressions

Parameters:expression – list((str,comparator,float)) expressions: A list of triples consisting of (method_name, comparator, threshold)
Returns:AResult
merge_results(others)[source]¶

Merges results of the same type and returns a merged result

Parameters:other (AResult) –
Returns:
class Fred2.Core.Result.CleavageFragmentPredictionResult(data=None, index=None, columns=None, dtype=None, copy=False)[source]¶

Bases: Fred2.Core.Result.AResult

Epitope prediction result

filter_result(expressions)[source]¶

filters a result data frame based on a specified expression consisting of a list of triple with (method_name, comparator, threshold). The expression is applied to each row. If any of the columns full fill the criteria the row remains.

Parameters:expressions (list((str,comparator,float))) – A list of triples consisting of (method_name, comparator, threshold)
Returns:filtered result object
merge_results(others)[source]¶

class Fred2.Core.Result.EpitopePredictionResult(data=None, index=None, columns=None, dtype=None, copy=False)[source]¶

Bases: Fred2.Core.Result.AResult

A AResult object is a DataFrame with with multi-indexing, where column Id are the prediction model (i.e HLA allele for epitope prediction), row ID the target of the prediction (i.e. peptide) and the second row ID the predictor (i.e BIMAS)

Epitope prediction result

Fred2.Core.Transcript module¶

class Fred2.Core.Transcript.Transcript(_seq, _gene_id='unknown', _transcript_id=None, _vars=None)[source]¶

Bases: Fred2.Core.Base.MetadataLogger, Bio.Seq.Seq

A Transcript is the mRNA sequence containing at no or several variations.

Note

For accessing and manipulating the sequence see also Bio.Seq.Seq (from Biopython)

Parameters:
  • gene_id (str) – Genome ID
  • transcript_id (str) – Transcript RefSeqID
  • vars (dict(int,Variant)) – Dict of Variants for specific positions in the transcript. key=position, value=Variant
newid = <method-wrapper 'next' of itertools.count object>¶

Fred2.Core.Variant module¶

class Fred2.Core.Variant.MutationSyntax(transID, transPos, protPos, cds, aas)[source]¶

This class represents the mutation syntax of a variant and stores its transcript and protein position

Parameters:
  • transID (str) – the transcript id
  • transPos (int) – the position of the variant within the transcript
  • protPos (int) – the protein position of the variant within the transcript
  • cds (str) – the complete cds_mutation_syntax string
  • aas (str) – the complete protein_mutation_syntax string
class Fred2.Core.Variant.Variant(id, type, chrom, genomePos, ref, obs, coding, isHomozygous, isSynonymous, experimentalDesign=None, metadata=None)[source]¶

Bases: Fred2.Core.Base.MetadataLogger

A Variant contains information about a single genetic modification of the reference genome.

Parameters:
  • id (str) – Variant id
  • type (Enum.VariationType) – An Enum type of the variant either SNP, DEL, or INS
  • chrom (str) – The chromosome on which the variant lies
  • genomePos (int) – The genomic position of the variant
  • ref (str) – The reference seq at the genomic position
  • obs (str) – The observed variation at the genomic position
  • coding (dict(str,MutationSyntax)) – A dictionary of associated transcripts. Key=transcript_id, value=MutationSyntax
  • isHomozygous (bool) – defines if variant is homozygous or not
  • isSynonymous (bool) – defines if variant is a synonymous mutation or not
  • offsets (dict(str,int)) – the position offset this variant has in a specific transcript-variant key=transcript-variant-id (xxx:FRED2_nn) value=offset
  • metadata (defaultdict(list)) – meta information (not relevant for core functionality of Fred2)
get_protein_position(trans_variant_id)[source]¶

Note

May only be used for transcript variants that were created from this variant via :func:

Generator.generate_transcripts_from_variants. ..TODO:: what? that should not be encoded in transcript id but in separate member

returns the specific protein position of a given transcript_id. If variant is not associated with the given transcript id the function throws a KeyError

Parameters:transcriptId (str) – A transcript_id
Returns:(int) – the protein position of the variant
Raises:KeyError
